articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli planes and tanks pounded areas across the Gaza Strip, residents said, as White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan met Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday amid U.S. calls for a more focused military campaign.
articles.title: Israel launches strikes across Gaza as U.S. envoy meets Netanyahu

articles.author: Michael Holden, Sam Tobin
articles.description: The judgment marks the culmination of 13 years of legal battles and detentions.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Julian Assange faces U.S. extradition judgment day

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France has mobilised hundreds of police to regain control of the main road linking the airport to New Caledonia capital Noumea and restore order after days of unrest, the French minister of interior Gerald Darmanin said in a post on X late on Saturday.
articles.title: France mobilises police to regain control of New Caledonia airport road

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Russian airstrikes killed at least five people and injured 16 others in a recreation area just outside Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv on Sunday, local officials said.
articles.title: Russian air attack on Kharkiv kills at least five, says local official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan met to discuss Israel's war in Gaza and seek to complete a broad bilateral agreement, the Saudi state news agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Saudi crown prince, US national security adviser meet on Gaza, bilateral ties

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Christine Uyanik, Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico is no longer in immediate danger but still in a serious condition, his deputy said on Sunday, four days after an assassination attempt that sent shockwaves through Europe.
articles.title: Slovak PM Fico no longer in immediate danger but condition serious, deputy says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 47 people have died after continued heavy rain and flooding in northern Afghanistan, an official said on Sunday, a day after a similar number were killed in a central province.
articles.title: Forty-seven dead in heavy rain, floods in northern Afghanistan, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jeff Bezos' space firm Blue Origin is scheduled on Sunday to launch its first crew of humans to the edge of space since the company's suborbital New Shepard rocket was grounded in 2022, resuming its space tourism business.
articles.title: Bezos' Blue Origin to launch first crew to edge of space since 2022 grounding

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uganda's military has captured a commander of an Islamic State-allied rebel group who is an expert in making improvised explosive devices, or bombs, that the group has used to carry out deadly attacks in the past, the army said on Sunday.
articles.title: Uganda captures bomb expert of Islamic State-allied rebel group

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Voters in the Dominican Republic head to the polls on Sunday to cast ballots for the next president and members of parliament in an election widely seen as a referendum on the hugely popular incumbent and anti-corruption crusader, Luis Abinader.
articles.title: Dominican Republic voters head to polls, incumbent Abinader the favorite
